text: Isolona is a genus of flowering plants in the family Annonaceae. There are 21 species native to Africa. They occur in humid habitat types.Couvreur, T. L., Gereau, R. E., Wieringa, J. J., & Richardson, J. E. (2006). Description of four new species of Monodora and Isolona (Annonaceae) from Tanzania and an overview of Tanzanian Annonaceae diversity. Adansonia (Paris), 28(2), 243-266. Species include:Isolona. The Plant List. * Isolona campanulata Engler & Diels * Isolona capuronii Cavaco & Keraudren * Isolona cauliflora Verdc. * Isolona congolana (De Wild. & T. Durand) Engl. & Diels * Isolona cooperi Hutchinson & Dalziel * Isolona deightonii Keay * Isolona dewevrei Engl. & Diels. * Isolona ghesquierei Cavaco & Keraudren * Isolona heinsenii Engl. & Diels * Isolona hexaloba Engler * Isolona humbertiana Ghesq. ex Cavaco & Keraudr. * Isolona lebrunii Boutique * Isolona letestui Pellegr. * Isolona linearis * Isolona madagascariensis (A.DC.) Engl. * Isolona maitlandii Keay * Isolona perrieri Diels * Isolona pilosa Diels * Isolona pleurocarpa Diels * Isolona thonneri (De Wild. & T.Durand) Engl. & Diels * Isolona zenkeri Engl. ==References== Category:Annonaceae genera Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Isolona
